User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Edoxia-TCG application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

registrationDate.description: The date and time the user registered.

definition.description: Stores user data. Path-based ownership ensures only the authenticated user can access their own data.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.  Matches the Firebase Auth UID.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure prioritizes security, scalability, and debuggability by adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence, Structural Segregation, and Access Modeling. User data is stored in a private collection, ensuring that only the authenticated user can access their own information. Specifically, the `/users/{userId}` path provides path-based ownership, making security rules straightforward and efficient. The absence of collaborative data at this stage simplifies the structure, focusing on core user management. This design uses a single collection for users. This structure avoids `get()` calls in rules, enabling atomic operations and easier debugging. Rules will be more robust and maintainable.
